trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of exercise in a reduced oxygen environment on changes in body composition.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of normobaric hypoxic training on changes in body composition, in overweight, healthy males and females aged between 18-40 years.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Research that is not of generic health relevance and not applicable to specific health categories listed above

interventions.interventions:
Normobaric hypoxia (15% oxygen concentration).
Four weeks total, three (3) times a week, 60 min per session, at 65% maximal heart rate.
Sessions will be completed on a cycling ergometer, in a room that has the capacity to have its oxygen concentration altered.
The washout period will last one week.
interventions.comparator:
Normobaric normoxia (21% oxygen concentration).
Four weeks total, three (3) times a week, 60 min per session, at 65% maximal heart rate.
Sessions will be completed on a cycling ergometer.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changed body composition as measured by a reduction in total fat through Dual-Energy Xray Absiorptiometry (DEXA).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Three DEXA scans in total, over 10 weeks. 1. Prior to training period 1. 2. Between training periods 1 and 2. 3. After training period 2.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - previous history of intolerance to exercise at altitude - known medical conditions that the subject has been advised may compromise safe participation (high blood pressure, cardiovascular disease, history of fainting) - Testing will be delayed if a subject has an illness 24 hrs prior to a test session or an injury that they have received medical treatment for or would limit their ability to cycle - A testing session will be terminated if subject's percent oxygen saturation drops below 75% - current smoker - known asthmatic

trial_design.concealment: Central randomisation by computer. Staff member conducting randomisation procedure not involved in direct contact with subjects.
trial_design.sequence: Treatment allocation will be by use of randomised number procedures within Microsoft Excel. Lower numbers will be allocated to the initial treatment condition.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: New South Wales Institute of Sport
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 6B Figtree Drive Sydney Olympic Park NSW, 2127

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
This study seeks to examine the effect of normobaric hypoxia exposure and exercise on changes in body mass and body composition.
It is hypothesised that there will be no additional effect of exercising in normobaric hypoxia on the rate of change in body composition induced by regular exercise.
